disableStreamCache.label: producer
disableStreamCache.description: Determines whether or not the raw input stream is cached or not. The producer (camel-jdk-http) will by default cache the response body stream. If setting this option to true, then the producers will not cache the response body stream but use the response stream as-is (the stream can only be read once) as the message body.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

responseBodyAsByteArray.label: producer
responseBodyAsByteArray.description: Determines whether or not the HTTP response body is converted to byte array or not. The producer (camel-jdk-http) will by default use InputStream for read HTTP response body.

throwExceptionOnFailure.label: producer
throwExceptionOnFailure.description: Option to disable throwing the HttpOperationFailedException in case of failed responses from the remote server. This allows you to get all responses regardless of the HTTP status code.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

http2Priority.label: advanced
http2Priority.description: Sets the default priority for any HTTP/2 requests sent from JDK HttpClient. The value provided must be between 1 and 256 (inclusive).

httpVersion.label: advanced
httpVersion.description: Requests a specific HTTP protocol version where possible. If this method is not invoked prior to building, then newly built clients will prefer HTTP/2. If set to HTTP/2, then each request will attempt to upgrade to HTTP/2. If the upgrade succeeds, then the response to this request will use HTTP/2 and all subsequent requests and responses to the same origin server will use HTTP/2. If the upgrade fails, then the response will be handled using HTTP/1.1

okStatusCodeRanges.label: advanced
okStatusCodeRanges.description: The status codes which are considered a success response. The values are inclusive. Multiple ranges can be defined, separated by comma, e.g. 200-204,209,301-304. Each range must be a single number or from-to with the dash included.

redirectPolicy.label: advanced
redirectPolicy.description: Specifies whether requests will automatically follow redirects issued by the server. Normal policy means always redirect, except from HTTPS URLs to HTTP URLs.

useSystemProperties.label: advanced
useSystemProperties.description: To use System Properties as fallback for configuration for configuring JDK HttpClient.

async.label: async,advanced
async.description: To use asynchronous Camel Endpoint implementation and JDK HttpClient call.

headerFilterStrategy.label: filter
headerFilterStrategy.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.spi.HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

sslContextParameters.label: security
sslContextParameters.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters. Important: Only one instance of org.apache.camel.support.jsse.SSLContextParameters is supported per JdkHttpComponent. If you need to use 2 or more different instances, you need to define a new JdkHttpComponent per instance you need.

useGlobalSslContextParameters.label: security
useGlobalSslContextParameters.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.

connectTimeout.label: timeout
connectTimeout.description: Sets the connect timeout duration for JDK HttpClient. In the case where a new connection needs to be established, if the connection cannot be established within the given duration, then HttpClient::send throws an HttpConnectTimeoutException, or HttpClient::sendAsync completes exceptionally with an HttpConnectTimeoutException. If a new connection does not need to be established, for example if a connection can be reused from a previous request, then this timeout duration has no effect.

responseTimeout.label: timeout
responseTimeout.description: Sets a timeout for HTTP request. If the response is not received within the specified timeout then an HttpTimeoutException is thrown from HttpClient::send or HttpClient::sendAsync completes exceptionally with an HttpTimeoutException.

CamelHttpProtocolVersion.label: producer
CamelHttpProtocolVersion.description: The version of the HTTP protocol used.

CamelHttpScheme.label: producer
CamelHttpScheme.description: URI scheme. Will override existing URI scheme set directly on the endpoint. Can be http or https only.

CamelHttpHost.label: producer
CamelHttpHost.description: URI host. Will override existing URI host set directly on the endpoint.

CamelHttpPort.label: producer
CamelHttpPort.description: URI port. Will override existing URI port set directly on the endpoint.

CamelHttpPath.label: producer
CamelHttpPath.description: URI path. Will override existing URI path set directly on the endpoint.

CamelHttpQuery.label: producer
CamelHttpQuery.description: URI parameters. Will override existing URI parameters set directly on the endpoint.

CamelHttpUri.label: producer
CamelHttpUri.description: URI to call. Will override existing URI set directly on the endpoint.

CamelHttpResponseCode.label: producer
CamelHttpResponseCode.description: The HTTP response code from the external server.

CamelHttpResponseText.label: producer
CamelHttpResponseText.description: he HTTP response text from the external server.

httpUri.description: The URL of the HTTP endpoint to call.

disableStreamCache.label: producer
disableStreamCache.description: Determines whether or not the raw input stream is cached or not. The producer (camel-jdk-http) will by default cache the response body stream. If setting this option to true, then the producers will not cache the response body stream but use the response stream as-is (the stream can only be read once) as the message body.
